snippet: Tour Commissioner Tim Finchem expressed concern Tuesday about the format’s fairness, in part because some players, like Tiger Woods, tend to get more TV time than others.
abstract: PGA policy board will reexamine rules that allow anyone, even TV viewers, to submit evidence of infractions by golfers that were not detected on the spot; Commissioner Tim Finchem notes that format may unfairly disadvantage players, like Tiger Woods, who are featured on television far more often than others.
lead_paragraph: Tour Commissioner Tim Finchem expressed concern Tuesday about the format’s fairness, in part because some players, like Tiger Woods, tend to get more TV time than others.

headline.main: PGA to Discuss Reducing Viewers’ Impact on Penalties
headline.print_headline: PGA to Discuss Limiting Viewers’ Impact on Results
